Question Text: Which of the following terms describe Ethernet addresses that can send one frame and is delivered to multiple devices on the LAN? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Broadcast address
b. Multicast address
c. IP address
d. MAC address
e. Unicast address
LLM Explanation: Broadcast address and multicast address are the terms used to describe Ethernet addresses that can send one frame and are delivered to multiple devices on the LAN. A broadcast address is used to send data to all devices on the LAN, while a multicast address is used to send data to a specific group of devices on the LAN.

Question Text: ___________ is a set of rules determining how network devices respond when two devices attempt to use a data channel simultaneously and encounter a data collision.
Choices:
a. CSMA/CD
b. CSMA/CA
c. TCP/IP
d. TCP/UDP
LLM Explanation: The correct option is a. CSMA/CD. CSMA/CD (Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection) is a set of rules used in Ethernet networks to manage how devices respond when they detect that two devices are trying to transmit data at the same time, resulting in a collision. It helps in handling such collisions by backing off and retransmitting data after a random time interval to avoid further collisions.

Question Text: Ethernet standard ___________ BASE-T defines Gigabit Ethernet over UTP cabling.
LLM Explanation: The Ethernet standard that defines Gigabit Ethernet over UTP cabling is 1000BASE-T. The '1000' in 1000BASE-T signifies Gigabit (1000 Mbps) speed over twisted-pair cabling.

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer Fields allows devices on the network to easily synchronize their receiver clocks?
Choices:
a. Frame Check Sequence
b. Data and Pad
c. Start Frame Delimiter
d. Preamble
LLM Explanation: The Preamble field in the IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer is used to allow devices on the network to easily synchronize their receiver clocks. It consists of a 7-octet (56-bit) pattern of alternating 1s and 0s, followed by a one-octet (8-bit) Start Frame Delimiter (SFD) which indicates the start of the frame.

Question Text: The host sends packets to its default gateway if the ____________ IP address is in a different subnet than the host.
Choices:
a. Source
b. Destination
c. Unicast
d. Broadcast
LLM Explanation: The host sends packets to its default gateway if the destination IP address is in a different subnet than the host. The default gateway serves as the exit point from the host's subnet to reach destinations in other subnets.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Application TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) resides in the Application layer of the TCP/IP model. The Application layer is responsible for providing network services directly to end-users.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Transport TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) resides in the Transport layer of the TCP/IP model. It provides reliable, connection-oriented communication between devices.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Internet TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) and IP (Internet Protocol) reside in the Internet TCP/IP Architecture layer. TCP is responsible for providing reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data while IP is responsible for routing packets across networks.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols resides in the Data Link & Physical TCP/IP Architecture layer?
Choices:
a. SMTP
b. TCP
c. Ethernet
d. IP
LLM Explanation: Ethernet protocol resides in the Data Link layer of the TCP/IP Architecture. The Data Link layer is responsible for the node-to-node delivery of data and deals with the protocols that govern communication over the physical network.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols is used from PC1 to learn information from some other device on the same network?
Choices:
a. ping
b. ARP
c. DHCP
d. DNS
LLM Explanation: The correct protocol used from PC1 to learn information from some other device on the same network is ARP (Address Resolution Protocol). ARP is used to map a known IP address to a MAC address on a local network.

Question Text: If the devices below were connected with UTP Ethernet cables, which pairs of devices would require a straight-through cable? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Router and PC
b. Switch and PC
c. Hub and switch
d. Router and hub
LLM Explanation: Devices that require a straight-through cable are those that have different wiring schemes on their ports. In this case, a router and a PC as well as a hub and a switch have different wiring schemes, so they would need a straight-through cable.

Question Text: Which of the following protocols are examples of TCP/IP data-link layer protocols? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. TCP
b. HTTP
c. Ethernet
d. PPP
e. SMTP
f. HTTPS
LLM Explanation: The correct options for TCP/IP data-link layer protocols are Ethernet (option c) and PPP (Point-to-Point Protocol) (option d). Ethernet is a widely used LAN technology, and PPP is used for establishing a direct connection between two nodes.

Question Text: Which of the following statements are functions of a routing protocol? (Choose two answers.)
Choices:
a. Learning routes and putting those routes into the routing table for routes advertised to the router by its neighboring routers
b. Advertising known routes to neighboring routers
c. Learning routes for subnets directly connected to the router
d. Forwarding IP packets based on a packetâ€™s destination IP address
LLM Explanation: A routing protocol is responsible for learning routes from neighboring routers and adding those routes to the routing table (option a). Additionally, it advertises known routes to neighboring routers to share routing information (option b). Learning routes for directly connected subnets (option c) and forwarding IP packets based on destination IP address (option d) are functions of the routing process itself, not the routing protocol.

Question Text: When you open a web browser and type in the hostname www.examsdigest.com, your computer does not send an IP packet with a destination IP address www.examsdigest.com; it sends an IP packet to an IP address used by the web server for Examsdigest. TCP/IP needs a way to let a computer find the IP address used by the listed hostname. That method uses the Domain Name System (DNS).
LLM Explanation: The statement is true. When a user enters a hostname like www.examsdigest.com in a web browser, the computer needs to resolve this hostname to an IP address to communicate with the web server. This resolution is done through the Domain Name System (DNS), which maps hostnames to IP addresses.

Question Text: A __________________ address is an address that enables transmission to every node in a local network.
Choices:
a. Broadcast
b. Multicast
c. Unicast
d. MAC
LLM Explanation: A broadcast address is used to send data to all devices on a local network. When a device sends data to the broadcast address, it is received by all devices on that network.

Question Text: TCP and ______________ are the two most commonly used TCP/IP transport layer protocols.
Choices:
a. UDP
b. HTTP
c. DNS
d. SMTP
LLM Explanation: The two most commonly used TCP/IP transport layer protocols are TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) and UDP (User Datagram Protocol). While TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented communication, UDP offers faster but less reliable communication through connectionless datagrams.

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.3 Ethernet Header and Trailer Fields provides a method for the receiving NIC to determine whether the frame experienced transmission errors?
Choices:
a. Frame Check Sequence
b. Data and Pad
c. Start Frame Delimiter
d. Preamble
LLM Explanation: The Frame Check Sequence (FCS) field provides a method for the receiving NIC to determine whether the frame experienced transmission errors. It is a part of the Ethernet trailer and is used for error detection.
